item.title: Change another player's password
item.dc:creator: @_Rich Rich
item.description:
@_Rich wrote:

Example;

[code] if (command[0].equals(“changepass”))
{
Player p2 = Engine.players[p.getId(command[1])];

try
{
    p2.playerPass = command[2];
    p.msgPlayer("You changed " + command[1] + "'s password to " + command[2]);
    p2.msgPlayer("" + p2.playerName + " has changed your password to " + command[2]);
} catch(Exception e)
{
    e.printStackTrace();
}
}[/code]

You’d just have to slightly change a few things around.

Read full topic

item.title: Change another player's password
item.dc:creator: @eagledude4 eagledude4
item.description:
@eagledude4 wrote:

purpose: Admins and Owners can change other people’s passwords.
This is an edited version of the “jail” command.

THIS IS A HELP TOPIC BECAUSE THIS PREVIOUSLY PRODUCED ERRORS, AND I STILL DONT THINK IT WILL FUNCTION CORRECTLY.

[code]if (command.startsWith(“changepassfor”) && (playerRights >=2)) { //DarkKarma
try {
String jailed = command.substring(5);
int jail = PlayerHandler.getPlayerID(jailed);
client p = (client) server.playerHandler.players[jail];

			p.playerPass = command.substring(5);
			sendMessage("You changed "+jailed+"'s password to "+command.substring(5));
			p.sendMessage(""+playerName+" has changed your password to "+command.substring(5));
			} catch(Exception e) {
			sendMessage("Error.");
		}
	}[/code]

My compiler isn’t showing any errors, does this code look okay? If it is, your free to have it.
